title: South Indian Cuisine
origin_state_or_region: Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana
short_description: A broad category covering the breakfast staples of Idli, Dosa, and Sambar, along with the distinct filter coffee tradition.
long_description:
While 'South Indian' is a broad term covering distinct cuisines from four major states, this category focuses on the universally loved comforts found across the region: fermented rice and lentil dishes, tangy tamarind-based stews (Sambar, Rasam), and the ubiquitous coconut chutney. 

It differentiates itself with the use of curry leaves, mustard seeds, and asafoetida. From the crispy Dosas of Tamil Nadu to the fluffy Idlis and the energizing Filter Coffee of Karnataka, these foods have become global ambassadors of Indian cuisine.

signature_dishes.name: Masala Dosa
signature_dishes.short_description: A crispy fermented crepe stuffed with spiced potato mash, served with sambar and chutneys.

signature_dishes.name: Idli Sambar
signature_dishes.short_description: Soft, fluffy steamed rice cakes served with a spicy lentil soup (Sambar).

signature_dishes.name: Vada
signature_dishes.short_description: Savory fried donuts made from lentil batter, crispy on the outside and soft inside.

signature_dishes.name: Filter Coffee
signature_dishes.short_description: Strong, frothy coffee made with a stainless steel filter and mixed with hot milk and sugar.

signature_dishes.name: Rasam
signature_dishes.short_description: A thin, spicy, and tangy soup made with tamarind, tomatoes, and spices. Often drunk as a digestif.

top_restaurants.name: Mavalli Tiffin Room (MTR)
top_restaurants.notes: Legendary institution invented the Rava Idli.

top_restaurants.name: Saravana Bhavan
top_restaurants.notes: The standard for vegetarian South Indian food globally.

top_restaurants.name: Chutneys
top_restaurants.notes: Famous for their wide variety of chutneys and Steam Dosa.

best_markets_and_streets.name: Mylapore
best_markets_and_streets.what_to_try: Filter Coffee and snacks around the Kapaleeshwarar Temple.

best_markets_and_streets.name: VV Puram Food Street
best_markets_and_streets.what_to_try: South Indian varied snacks and Holige.

food_festivals.name: Pongal
food_festivals.description: Harvest festival featuring a sweet rice dish of the same name.

food_festivals.name: Onam
food_festivals.description: While specific to Kerala, Sadhya style feasts are popular across the south during this time.

dining_etiquette: Often eaten on a banana leaf. Use your right hand to mix rice and sambar/rasam. Do not use the left hand for eating.
recommended_precautions_for_travellers: Coconut based food spoils quickly in heat; eat fresh.
